page.title: 10A working farm 1.Wested
page.content: Wested farm is typical of a farm in Crockenhill.Today it is a 800 acre farm producing barley and durum wheat.When the farm was started in 1908 it produced fruit and market garden crops and covered some 400acres.At certain times hops were grown and these were brought by local breweries.The market gardening was stopped in 1977 due to the long dry summer and the fluctuating price of vegetables.The growing of cereals has meant the enlarging of fields and destruction of hedgerows and woods.The farm today employs 1 full time and 1 part time,in the past it employed up to 30 people and more at harvest time.The farmer does not practice rotation but uses large quantities of chemical fertilisers.The planting is carried out in autumn and the harvesting between July and September.
